Detailed Description

Functions for managing thread pools.

Function Documentation

int create_idle_thread ( thread_pool *  pool  ) 

Create a new idle thread in thread pool POOL. This function expects NETWORK_POOL.EMPTY.MUTEX and NETWORK_POOL.IDLE.MUTEX to be locked.

int destroy_idle_thread ( thread_pool *  pool  ) 

Destroy an idle thread in thread pool POOL. This function expects NETWORK_POOL.EMPTY.MUTEX and NETWORK_POOL.IDLE.MUTEX to be locked.

bool get_running ( void   ) 

Get value of RUNNING flag.

thread_state get_thread_state ( thread *  t  ) 

Get state of thread T.

void set_thread_state ( thread *  t,
thread_state  state 
)

Set state of thread T.

void thread_disable_signals ( void   ) 

Disable receiving signals by calling thread.

bool thread_pool_create ( thread_pool *  pool,
thread_limit *  limit,
thread_start  main_start,
thread_start  worker_start,
thread_init  worker_init 
)

Initialize the thread pool.

Parameters:
pool The thread pool to initialize.
limit Limits for number of threads.
main_start Start routine of the main thread of the pool.
worker_start Start routine of the worker thread of the pool.
worker_init Initialization of the worker thread.

void thread_pool_destroy ( thread_pool *  pool  ) 

Destroy thread pool POOL - terminate idle threads, wait for active threads to finish, free memory associated with thread pool.

void thread_pool_regulate ( thread_pool *  pool  ) 

Kill/create threads when there are too many or not enough idle threads. It expects NETWORK_POOL.IDLE.MUTEX to be locked.

static void * thread_pool_regulator ( void *  data  )  [static]

Main function of thread regulating the thread pool. DATA is the structure with additional information for the regulator.

void thread_pool_terminate ( thread_pool *  pool  ) 

Terminate the main and regulator threads in thread pool POOL and tell worker threads to finish.

bool thread_pool_terminate_p ( thread_pool *  pool  ) 

Shall the worker threads terminate?

void thread_terminate_blocking_syscall ( volatile pthread_t *  thid,
pthread_mutex_t *  mutex 
)

Terminate blocking syscall in thread *THID. We mark the blocking syscall by locking MUTEX.

int wait_for_thread_to_die ( volatile pthread_t *  thid,
void **  ret 
)

Wait for thread *THID to die and store its return value to RET.

Variable Documentation

thread_limit kernel_thread_limit = {4, 1, 2}

Limits for number of kernel threads.

thread_limit network_thread_limit = {8, 2, 4}

Limits for number of network threads.

volatile bool running = true

Flag that zfsd is running. It is set to 0 when zfsd is shutting down.

pthread_mutex_t running_mutex

Mutex protecting RUNNING.

pthread_key_t thread_data_key

Key for thread specific data.

pthread_key_t thread_name_key

Key for thread name.

thread_limit update_thread_limit = {4, 1, 2}

Limits for number of update threads.
